question: Purchase a blackboard eraser. Now, what happens?
Purchase a blackboard eraser. Keep the blackboard eraser in the glove box or attach it to a spot on or near the car door for easy access. Now, what happens?

Purchase a blackboard eraser. Keep the blackboard eraser in the glove box or attach it to a spot on or near the car door for easy access. Use the eraser to clean the inner side of the windshield. Now, what happens?

Purchase a blackboard eraser. Keep the blackboard eraser in the glove box or attach it to a spot on or near the car door for easy access. Use the eraser to clean the inner side of the windshield. Replace after use. Now, what happens?

Bend one pipe cleaner in half to form the legs. Shape another pipe cleaner to form the body. Now, what happens?

Knit eighty-four inches of flat web. Now, what happens?
Knit eighty-four inches of flat web. Begin five inches from the end of the web, turn and sew into a rectangular form five inches wide and eight inches long. Now, what happens?

Knit eighty-four inches of flat web. Begin five inches from the end of the web, turn and sew into a rectangular form five inches wide and eight inches long. Join the five-inch ends, and draw in the top with the needle and a piece of the material from which the cap was made. Now, what happens?

Knit eighty-four inches of flat web. Begin five inches from the end of the web, turn and sew into a rectangular form five inches wide and eight inches long. Join the five-inch ends, and draw in the top with the needle and a piece of the material from which the cap was made. After securing the top, twist and fold the piece of yarn remaining for a cord and fasten a number of strands of yarn through the loop for a tassel. Now, what happens?
Sniper — Simply aim at the head and pull the trigger, unless you're the host, in which case you will need to aim in front of where they're going. Now, what happens?

Sniper — Simply aim at the head and pull the trigger, unless you're the host, in which case you will need to aim in front of where they're going. Shotgun — The aim on the shotgun is almost like a rectangle. Now, what happens?

Sniper — Simply aim at the head and pull the trigger, unless you're the host, in which case you will need to aim in front of where they're going. Shotgun — The aim on the shotgun is almost like a rectangle. Pistol — I'm not sure because I haven't played in a while, but it's either six or seven shots to the head with the standard-issue pistol for a headshot. Now, what happens?

Sniper — Simply aim at the head and pull the trigger, unless you're the host, in which case you will need to aim in front of where they're going. Shotgun — The aim on the shotgun is almost like a rectangle. Pistol — I'm not sure because I haven't played in a while, but it's either six or seven shots to the head with the standard-issue pistol for a headshot. BoomShot — BoomShot headshots are possible — don't let anyone tell you they're not but the chance of one happening is about a million to one. Now, what happens?

Plug in your HDMI cord to the cable. Plug it into your TV's HDMI input. Plug it into your wii's AV Composite Output instead of putting in the Composite cord that comes with the Wii. Plug your HDMI cord (assuming you have one) into the converter and your TV. Now, what happens?

Fold the towel in thirds lengthwise. Fold in half, and then in half again. Now, what happens?
Fold the towel in thirds lengthwise. Fold in half, and then in half again. Store the towel in the linen closet. Now, what happens?

Fold the towel in thirds lengthwise. Fold in half, and then in half again. Store the towel in the linen closet. To go from the closet for hanging, simply unfold the final fold and hang on the towel rack. Now, what happens?
Set-up your spy group You will need a trustworthy 2-5 person group. Now, what happens?

Set-up your spy group You will need a trustworthy 2-5 person group. It's good to have a place to keep your gear when not in use, hold meetings, and just talk in private without worrying about the nosiness of certain people in public places. Now, what happens?

Set-up your spy group You will need a trustworthy 2-5 person group. It's good to have a place to keep your gear when not in use, hold meetings, and just talk in private without worrying about the nosiness of certain people in public places. Get some gear To be a good spy, you and your friends must have gear that will help with missions. Now, what happens?

Set-up your spy group You will need a trustworthy 2-5 person group. It's good to have a place to keep your gear when not in use, hold meetings, and just talk in private without worrying about the nosiness of certain people in public places. Get some gear To be a good spy, you and your friends must have gear that will help with missions. Find your first "victim" The victim is the person you will be watching and spying on. Now, what happens?
There is no chance in hell you will kill a Thug using just your bear hands and feet. Now, what happens?

There is no chance in hell you will kill a Thug using just your bear hands and feet. Incendiary Weapons - Grenades or Molotov Cocktails *WARNING* You may need to use a couple of these, so it is recommended that you only use one when a Thugs' health is below 50%. Now, what happens?

There is no chance in hell you will kill a Thug using just your bear hands and feet. Incendiary Weapons - Grenades or Molotov Cocktails *WARNING* You may need to use a couple of these, so it is recommended that you only use one when a Thugs' health is below 50%. Make sure your guns have enough ammo, and your knives are up to scratch. Now, what happens?

There is no chance in hell you will kill a Thug using just your bear hands and feet. Incendiary Weapons - Grenades or Molotov Cocktails *WARNING* You may need to use a couple of these, so it is recommended that you only use one when a Thugs' health is below 50%. Make sure your guns have enough ammo, and your knives are up to scratch. Attack! Now, what happens?

Brown the meat and the onion in a medium sized frying pan. Drain the excess fat. Add the remaining ingredients (except for the hot sauce) and simmer for fifteen minutes. Now, what happens?

Obtain a decent sized eraser that you can hold comfortable in your fingers. Kneel down next to the linoleum and use the eraser to rub along the skid mark. Now, what happens?

When you begin the game, you will start as Princess Leia and Captain Antilles in the Star Wars cantina. Now, what happens?

When you begin the game, you will start as Princess Leia and Captain Antilles in the Star Wars cantina. Use the up and down arrows to select the part of the character (hat, head, shirt, arms, hands, weapon, belt, and legs) and the left and right arrows to select through a selection of the body part you are on. Now, what happens?

When you begin the game, you will start as Princess Leia and Captain Antilles in the Star Wars cantina. Use the up and down arrows to select the part of the character (hat, head, shirt, arms, hands, weapon, belt, and legs) and the left and right arrows to select through a selection of the body part you are on. Press "triangle" to name it, and "O" to save and exit. Now, what happens?

When you begin the game, you will start as Princess Leia and Captain Antilles in the Star Wars cantina. Use the up and down arrows to select the part of the character (hat, head, shirt, arms, hands, weapon, belt, and legs) and the left and right arrows to select through a selection of the body part you are on. Press "triangle" to name it, and "O" to save and exit. Now enter a completed level and turn on free play. Now, what happens?

Prefer boarding across a solid platform if possible. Now, what happens?
Prefer boarding across a solid platform if possible. If you are crossing using a platform, hold on to the rails provided. Now, what happens?

Prefer boarding across a solid platform if possible. If you are crossing using a platform, hold on to the rails provided. Avoid plonking one leg in the boat and leaving one on the jetty - this will cause wobbling and you might fall into the water. Now, what happens?

Prefer boarding across a solid platform if possible. If you are crossing using a platform, hold on to the rails provided. Avoid plonking one leg in the boat and leaving one on the jetty - this will cause wobbling and you might fall into the water. Once in the boat, always remain in the centre line to move around it and lower yourself to a crouch level so that you reduce your centre of gravity and keep the craft as still as possible. Now, what happens?

Prefer boarding across a solid platform if possible. If you are crossing using a platform, hold on to the rails provided. Avoid plonking one leg in the boat and leaving one on the jetty - this will cause wobbling and you might fall into the water. Once in the boat, always remain in the centre line to move around it and lower yourself to a crouch level so that you reduce your centre of gravity and keep the craft as still as possible. Keep the craft steady as others board. Now, what happens?

Place the yogurt, bananas, and sorbet in a blender. Blend the mixture until it's smooth in texture. Pour the rum in and quickly blend again. Now, what happens?
Place the yogurt, bananas, and sorbet in a blender. Blend the mixture until it's smooth in texture. Pour the rum in and quickly blend again. Pour the smoothie into chilled glasses. Now, what happens?

Place the yogurt, bananas, and sorbet in a blender. Blend the mixture until it's smooth in texture. Pour the rum in and quickly blend again. Pour the smoothie into chilled glasses. Garnish each glass with a strawberry. Now, what happens?
Select suitable paper to make the pinwheels. Now, what happens?
Select suitable paper to make the pinwheels. Make enough pinwheels to create a wreath. Now, what happens?
Select suitable paper to make the pinwheels. Make enough pinwheels to create a wreath. Find a suitable base, such as a Styrofoam/cane/cardboard wreath base. Now, what happens?

Select suitable paper to make the pinwheels. Make enough pinwheels to create a wreath. Find a suitable base, such as a Styrofoam/cane/cardboard wreath base. If the wreath base lacks a hanger, add some twine or ribbon to create one. Now, what happens?

Select suitable paper to make the pinwheels. Make enough pinwheels to create a wreath. Find a suitable base, such as a Styrofoam/cane/cardboard wreath base. If the wreath base lacks a hanger, add some twine or ribbon to create one. Finished. Now, what happens?
Untwist wire hanger and shape into a circle, using pliers as needed. Now, what happens?
Untwist wire hanger and shape into a circle, using pliers as needed. Gently crumple 3" squares of wax paper or crepe paper and thread hanger through center of each square. Now, what happens?

Untwist wire hanger and shape into a circle, using pliers as needed. Gently crumple 3" squares of wax paper or crepe paper and thread hanger through center of each square. When you have threaded enough squares to fill length of hanger, gently push squares away from ends and use pliers to twist ends together. Now, what happens?

Untwist wire hanger and shape into a circle, using pliers as needed. Gently crumple 3" squares of wax paper or crepe paper and thread hanger through center of each square. When you have threaded enough squares to fill length of hanger, gently push squares away from ends and use pliers to twist ends together. Gently slide squares of paper back toward the joined ends of wire hanger, scrunching paper more for additional fullness. Now, what happens?

Untwist wire hanger and shape into a circle, using pliers as needed. Gently crumple 3" squares of wax paper or crepe paper and thread hanger through center of each square. When you have threaded enough squares to fill length of hanger, gently push squares away from ends and use pliers to twist ends together. Gently slide squares of paper back toward the joined ends of wire hanger, scrunching paper more for additional fullness. Finished. Now, what happens?

Wash especially well if you intend to keep the peel intact. Cut round and round, keeping the peel as thin as possible as you go. Drain the potatoes dry on a clean cloth. Fry the ribbons in deep, hot fat. Serve. Now, what happens?

Obtain some fizzy drink. Pour the fizzy drink over the bolt. Wipe it clean with kitchen towel. The fizzy drink should have dissolved the rust build-up causing the bolt to stick. Now, what happens?

Obtain some fizzy drink. Pour the fizzy drink over the bolt. Wipe it clean with kitchen towel. The fizzy drink should have dissolved the rust build-up causing the bolt to stick. Replace the rusty bolt. Now, what happens?

Preheat your oven beforehand to 400°F (200°C or Gas Mark 6). Add your olive oil into a baking or roasting tin large enough to hold all of your asparagus spears. Now, what happens?

Preheat your oven beforehand to 400°F (200°C or Gas Mark 6). Add your olive oil into a baking or roasting tin large enough to hold all of your asparagus spears. Cut off the ends of the asparagus spears and wrap enough Serrano ham around each asparagus spear until it is mostly covered but with top jagged part still open. Now, what happens?

Preheat your oven beforehand to 400°F (200°C or Gas Mark 6). Add your olive oil into a baking or roasting tin large enough to hold all of your asparagus spears. Cut off the ends of the asparagus spears and wrap enough Serrano ham around each asparagus spear until it is mostly covered but with top jagged part still open. Roast the asparagus in the oven for 8-10 minutes. Now, what happens?

Preheat your oven beforehand to 400°F (200°C or Gas Mark 6). Add your olive oil into a baking or roasting tin large enough to hold all of your asparagus spears. Cut off the ends of the asparagus spears and wrap enough Serrano ham around each asparagus spear until it is mostly covered but with top jagged part still open. Roast the asparagus in the oven for 8-10 minutes. Serve immediately with a main dish so your asparagus acts as a side order. Now, what happens?

Acquire oil based paints, which air dry slowly. Now, what happens?
Acquire oil based paints, which air dry slowly. The under-coat should be thin, and smooth, move your paint brush down the wood, don't paint up or horizontally. Now, what happens?

Acquire oil based paints, which air dry slowly. The under-coat should be thin, and smooth, move your paint brush down the wood, don't paint up or horizontally. Paint the second coat, but be much more careful this time, make sure there are no paint bubbles appearing and smooth out any drips or pools left over from the under-coat. Now, what happens?

Acquire oil based paints, which air dry slowly. The under-coat should be thin, and smooth, move your paint brush down the wood, don't paint up or horizontally. Paint the second coat, but be much more careful this time, make sure there are no paint bubbles appearing and smooth out any drips or pools left over from the under-coat. Be the most precise with this. Now, what happens?

Acquire oil based paints, which air dry slowly. The under-coat should be thin, and smooth, move your paint brush down the wood, don't paint up or horizontally. Paint the second coat, but be much more careful this time, make sure there are no paint bubbles appearing and smooth out any drips or pools left over from the under-coat. Be the most precise with this. Finished. Now, what happens?
